short_summary: Acquisition of a new Wood Chipper for Parks Canada Agency in Louisbourg, Nova Scotia Canada.
description: The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing this Request for Proposal (RFP) for the acquisition of a new Wood Chipper for Parks Canada Agency in Louisbourg, Nova Scotia Canada as detailed in Annex Statement of Requirement.
full_summary:
===============

### Request for Proposal for Wood Chipper

#### Contract Title

5P128-220355 Wood Chipper - Parks Canada - Fortress Louisbourg NS

#### Solicitation Number

WS4341295033

#### Tender Status

EXPIRED

#### Project Overview

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Parks Canada Agency, invites bidders to submit proposals for the acquisition of a new wood chipper for the Fortress Louisbourg, Nova Scotia. The proposed wood chipper is intended to support the agency's park maintenance activities. The Request for Proposal (RFP) contains detailed requirements for the contract.

#### Procurement Details

*   **Solicitation Method**: Competitive - Open bidding
*   **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
*   **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price
*   **Regions of Delivery**: Cape Breton

#### Contracting Entity

*   **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   **Contracting Entity Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5, Canada

#### End User

*   **End User**: Parks Canada Agency
*   **End User Address**: 30 Victoria Street, Gatineau, QC J8X 0B3, Canada

#### Contact Information

*   **Contact Person**: Lyne Leger
*   **Contact Email**: [lyne.leger2@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:lyne.leger2@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

#### Notice URL

https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18344574?extsite=MTgzNDQ1NzRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

#### Closing Date

2024-01-11T14:00:00

Please note the tender has EXPIRED.  Please visit Ariba to view the contract documentation.
================================

The document has been rewritten in a clear and concise manner. Here are a few things that have been done:

1.  Headings and subheadings have been used to organize the content.
2.  The text has been rephrased to make it more professional and readable.
3.  Unnecessary details have been removed, leaving only relevant information. 
4.  The emphasis on phrase will take the user most likely to what they can expect once
